on_tag.docs:
**, [Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when a tag is read. See [on_tag Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#rc522-on-tag).

*See also: [rc522 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#id1)*

on_tag_removed.docs:
**, [Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform after a tag is removed. See [on_tag_removed Trigger](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#rc522-on-tag-removed).

*See also: [rc522 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#id1)*

reset_pin.docs:
**, [Pin Schema](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-pin-schema)**: The pin connected to the RST line. Some tests shows the RC522 working okay without this.

*See also: [rc522 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#id1)*

update_interval.docs:
**, [Time](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-time)**: The duration of each scan on the RC522. This affects the duration that the individual binary sensors stay active when they’re found. If a device is not found within this time window, it will be marked as not present. Defaults to `1s`.

*See also: [rc522 Over I²C](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#id1)*

uid.docs:
**, string**: The unique ID of the NFC/RFID tag. This is a hyphen-separated list of hexadecimal values. For example `74-10-37-94`.

*See also: [rc522 Binary Sensor](https://esphome.io/components/binary_sensor/rc522.html#id3)*
